title: Yiddish Words in English
description: From chutzpah to schmuck, explore the colorful Yiddish words that have enriched the English language!

questions.question: The word 'chutzpah' is a well-known Yiddish loanword. What does it mean?
Which Yiddish word meaning 'to drag or pull' is used in English to mean carrying something heavy or trudging along?
The word 'glitch' is believed to come from the Yiddish 'glitsh.' What does 'glitsh' mean?
Which Yiddish word means 'to chat or talk in a friendly, persuasive way'?
The word 'klutz' comes from Yiddish. What does it mean?
Which Yiddish word for 'nerve' or 'gall' is often used when someone does something surprisingly bold?
The word 'kibitz' comes from Yiddish. What does it mean?
options: To offer unwanted advice or watch from the sidelines

questions.question: Which Yiddish word means 'excessive sentimentality' and literally refers to rendered chicken fat?
The word 'mensch' is a Yiddish compliment. What does it mean?
options: A person of integrity and honor

questions.question: Which Yiddish word means 'to complain or whine persistently'?
The word 'shtick' comes from Yiddish. In English, what does it usually refer to?
Which Yiddish word meaning 'to snack or nibble' is commonly used in English?
The word 'spiel' comes from Yiddish (originally German). What does it mean in English?
options: A lengthy or extravagant speech or sales pitch

questions.question: Which Yiddish word meaning 'a foolish or contemptible person' literally translates to something crude?
The word 'bagel' comes from the Yiddish 'beygl.' What is the likely origin of 'beygl'?
options: From a Middle High German word meaning 'ring or bracelet'
From a Polish word meaning 'boiled dough'
From a Yiddish word meaning 'round bread'
